block.p: Elizabeth Cotter McGroarty, a daughter of Elizabeth C. McGroarty and Robert G. McGroarty of Rowayton, Conn., was married last evening to Matthew Connolly Lucey, the son of Noreen K. Lucey and James J. Lucey III of Washington. The Rev. Brian McDermott, a Roman Catholic priest and family friend of the bride, performed the ceremony at the Shrine of St. Elizabeth Ann Seton in Manhattan. The Rev. Michael Hamilton, an Episcopal priest and an uncle of the bride, took part in the service.
Mrs. Lucey, 31, is a vice president specializing in client relationships at Saatchi & Saatchi, the New York advertising firm. She graduated from DePauw University.

Elizabeth Cotter McGroarty, a daughter of Elizabeth C. McGroarty and Robert G. McGroarty of Rowayton, Conn., was married last evening to Matthew Connolly Lucey, the son of Noreen K. Lucey and James J. Lucey III of Washington. The Rev. Brian McDermott, a Roman Catholic priest and family friend of the bride, performed the ceremony at the Shrine of St. Elizabeth Ann Seton in Manhattan. The Rev. Michael Hamilton, an Episcopal priest and an uncle of the bride, took part in the service.

Elizabeth Cotter McGroarty, a daughter of Elizabeth C. McGroarty and Robert G. McGroarty of Rowayton, Conn., was married last evening to Matthew Connolly Lucey, the son of Noreen K. Lucey and James J. Lucey III of Washington. The Rev. Brian McDermott, a Roman Catholic priest and family friend of the bride, performed the ceremony at the Shrine of St. Elizabeth Ann Seton in Manhattan. The Rev. Michael Hamilton, an Episcopal priest and an uncle of the bride, took part in the service.
Mrs. Lucey, 31, is a vice president specializing in client relationships at Saatchi & Saatchi, the New York advertising firm. She graduated from DePauw University.

Her father, a former cable television executive who helped develop MTV, Nickelodeon and the Movie Channel, is a financial consultant in Rowayton. Her mother is the director of home-buyer programs for the Housing Development Fund, a nonprofit agency in Stamford, Conn.
Mr. Lucey, 33, specializes in investing in private oil and gas companies at M. E. Zukerman & Company, an investment firm in Manhattan. He graduated from Marquette University.

His mother is an owner of Write for You, a stationery and gift store in Washington. His father retired from the Secret Service as special agent in charge of protective research. He is now chief of security at the National Gallery of Art in Washington.
